our vocabulary reduction method.from sentence: In subsection 3.2 , we showed that our vocabulary reduction method improves the coverage of supervised systems overall WordNet vocabulary .

coverage improvement.from sentence: In , we can see that this coverage improvement holds true on the evaluation tasks , for both training sets .

difference of scores.from sentence: Now if we look at the results in , the difference of scores obtained by our system using the sense vocabulary reduction or not is overall not significant ( regarding the " ALL " column ) .

sense reduction method.from sentence: Once again , the sense reduction method does not consistently improves or decreases the score on every task , and in overall ( task " ALL " ) , the result is roughly the same as without sense reduction applied .

very efficient method.from sentence: As we can see , ensembling is a very efficient method in WSD as it improves systematically all our results .

very large gap.from sentence: However we can notice a very large gap on the SemEval 2013 task , especially when the SemCor is used alone for training .

systematically state of the art results.from sentence: When we add the WordNet Gloss Tagged to the training data however , we obtain systematically state of the art results on all tasks except on SensEval 3 .

ensembles.from sentence: Interestingly , with ensembles , the scores are significantly higher when applying the vocabulary reduction algorithm .
